title: The Victorious Ascension
subtitle: When the King conquers the throne and sends the Spirit

key_verse.text: And when he had spoken these things, while they beheld, he was taken up; and a cloud received him out of their sight.

cards.title: Forty Days Later
cards.subtitle: The post-resurrection instruction period
cards.content:
Acts 1:3 says: 'To whom also he shewed himself alive after his passion by many infallible proofs, being seen of them forty days, and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God.'

üìÖ THE 40 DAYS:

For 40 days between resurrection and ascension:
‚Ä¢ Jesus appeared multiple times to the disciples
‚Ä¢ Ate with them (proved He had a physical resurrected body)
‚Ä¢ Taught them about the kingdom of God
‚Ä¢ Breathed on them the Holy Spirit (John 20:22)
‚Ä¢ Over 500 people saw Him alive (1 Corinthians 15:6)

‚õ∞Ô∏è THE MOUNT OF OLIVES:

‚Ä¢ Location: east of Jerusalem, across the Kidron Valley
‚Ä¢ Same place where:
  - Jesus prayed frequently
  - Jesus agonized in Gethsemane
  - Jesus wept over Jerusalem
  - Angels promised He will return (Acts 1:11)
  - Zechariah prophesied His feet will stand there when He returns (Zechariah 14:4)

üîÑ THE BIBLICAL PATTERN OF 40:

‚Ä¢ 40 days and nights of rain in the flood (Genesis 7:12)
‚Ä¢ 40 years of Israel in the wilderness (Numbers 14:33)
‚Ä¢ 40 days of Moses on Mount Sinai (Exodus 24:18)
‚Ä¢ 40 days of Elijah's journey to Horeb (1 Kings 19:8)
‚Ä¢ 40 days of Jesus's fast in the wilderness (Matthew 4:2)
‚Ä¢ 40 days of Jesus teaching about the kingdom (Acts 1:3)

The number 40 represents:
‚Ä¢ Testing and preparation
‚Ä¢ Transition between eras
‚Ä¢ Completeness of a period
cards.revelation_key: Jesus didn't ascend immediately. He spent 40 days PREPARING the disciples for what was coming. The ascension wasn't abandonment; it was promotion.

cards.title: Epƒìrthƒì: He Was Lifted Up
cards.subtitle: A journey of victory, not escape

greek_words.revelation:
The verb is in PASSIVE voice - 'was taken up,' not 'flew away.'

WHO lifted Him? The Father.

PHILIPPIANS 2:9 explains:
'Wherefore God also hath highly exalted (hyperypso≈ç) him, and given him a name which is above every name.'

The ascension was NOT:
‚Ä¢ Jesus fleeing from earth
‚Ä¢ Jesus retreating in defeat
‚Ä¢ Jesus leaving you alone

The ascension WAS:
‚Ä¢ The Father EXALTING the Son
‚Ä¢ The King taking His THRONE
‚Ä¢ The Victor receiving His CROWN
‚Ä¢ The High Priest entering the heavenly Holy of Holies
greek_words.application: When Jesus ascended, He didn't abandon you. He opened the way to God's throne and went to prepare a place for you.

greek_words.revelation:
NOT an ordinary meteorological cloud. It's the SHEKINAH - the visible glory of God.

The same cloud that:
‚Ä¢ Led Israel in the wilderness (Exodus 13:21)
‚Ä¢ Filled the tabernacle (Exodus 40:34)
‚Ä¢ Covered Mount Sinai (Exodus 24:15-16)
‚Ä¢ Appeared at the transfiguration (Matthew 17:5)
‚Ä¢ Carried Jesus in the ascension (Acts 1:9)
‚Ä¢ Will BRING Jesus in His second coming (Matthew 24:30)

üí° THE MESSAGE:

The SAME cloud that took Him in the ascension will bring Him in His return.

Acts 1:11: 'This same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall SO COME in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.'

‚Ä¢ Left in a cloud ‚Üí Will return in a cloud
‚Ä¢ Left from Mount of Olives ‚Üí Will return to Mount of Olives (Zechariah 14:4)
‚Ä¢ Left with resurrected body ‚Üí Will return with resurrected body
greek_words.application: The ascension isn't the end of the story. It's the intermission. The King who left WILL RETURN the same way.

cards.revelation_key: The ascension was a CORONATION, not a farewell. Jesus didn't leave earth defeated; He left victorious to sit at the Father's right hand.

cards.title: Ye Shall Receive Power
cards.subtitle: The Spirit's promise before the ascension
cards.content:
Acts 1:4-5, 8: 'And, being assembled together with them, commanded them that they should not depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father... For John truly baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost not many days hence... But ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you.'

üî• THE DIVINE SEQUENCE:

1Ô∏è‚É£ JESUS ASCENDS (Acts 1:9)
2Ô∏è‚É£ JESUS SITS AT THE FATHER'S RIGHT HAND (Mark 16:19)
3Ô∏è‚É£ JESUS SENDS THE HOLY SPIRIT (Acts 2:1-4)

Why in that order?

üìñ JOHN 16:7 explains:

'It is expedient for you that I go away: for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come unto you; but if I depart, I will send him unto you.'

üí° THE LOGIC:

‚Ä¢ While Jesus was on earth, He was LIMITED to a physical body
‚Ä¢ Could only be in ONE place at a time
‚Ä¢ Could only minister to a small group

BUT when Jesus ascended:
‚Ä¢ He sent the Holy Spirit
‚Ä¢ The Spirit has NO physical body
‚Ä¢ Can be in ALL believers simultaneously
‚Ä¢ Can be in ALL places at once

‚ö° THE PROMISED POWER:

'Ye shall receive POWER (dunamis - where we get 'dynamite')'

Not:
‚Ä¢ Power to do spectacular miracles (though that may happen)
‚Ä¢ Power to be famous

But:
‚Ä¢ Power to be WITNESSES (v.8)
‚Ä¢ Power to live in holiness
‚Ä¢ Power to proclaim the gospel boldly
‚Ä¢ Power to transform lives

üåç THE GEOGRAPHIC EXPANSION:

'Ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judaea, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth' (v.8)

This is the STRUCTURE of the book of Acts:
‚Ä¢ Chapters 1-7: Jerusalem
‚Ä¢ Chapters 8-9: Judea and Samaria
‚Ä¢ Chapters 10-28: To the uttermost part of the earth

scripture_connections.text: And it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh
But the Comforter, which is the Holy Ghost, whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things

cards.revelation_key: Jesus didn't leave to abandon you. He left to send you the BEST REPLACEMENT: the Holy Spirit, who lives IN you, not just WITH you.

cards.title: Seated at the Right Hand of God
cards.subtitle: The position of supreme authority
cards.content:
MARK 16:19: 'So then after the Lord had spoken unto them, he was received up into heaven, and sat on the right hand of God.'

üëë WHAT DOES 'RIGHT HAND' MEAN?

In ancient culture, the right hand represented:
‚Ä¢ Supreme POWER
‚Ä¢ Maximum AUTHORITY
‚Ä¢ Highest HONOR
‚Ä¢ Special FAVOR

When the king seated someone at his right, he declared:
‚Ä¢ This person shares my authority
‚Ä¢ This person rules with me
‚Ä¢ This person speaks with my voice

‚úùÔ∏è PSALM 110:1 (most quoted psalm in NT):

'The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.'

David prophesied 1,000 years before:
‚Ä¢ The Messiah would SIT (work finished)
‚Ä¢ At the RIGHT HAND (position of power)
‚Ä¢ Until enemies are DEFEATED

üî® HEBREWS 1:3:

'When he had by himself purged our sins, sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high.'

Note:
‚Ä¢ OT priests NEVER sat down (always more sacrifices)
‚Ä¢ Jesus SAT DOWN (the sacrifice was COMPLETE, FINAL, SUFFICIENT)

üìú WHAT JESUS DOES NOW AT THE RIGHT HAND:

1Ô∏è‚É£ INTERCEDES for you (Romans 8:34)
2Ô∏è‚É£ REPRESENTS you before the Father (Hebrews 7:25)
3Ô∏è‚É£ REIGNS over all (Ephesians 1:20-22)
4Ô∏è‚É£ PREPARES your place (John 14:2-3)
5Ô∏è‚É£ SENDS the Holy Spirit (John 15:26)

‚öîÔ∏è WAITING FOR FINAL VICTORY:

'Until I make thine enemies thy footstool' (Psalm 110:1)

Jesus is seated, but NOT inactive. He's REIGNING, waiting for the moment when:
‚Ä¢ Every enemy is subdued
‚Ä¢ Every knee bows
‚Ä¢ Every tongue confesses Jesus is Lord

scripture_anchor.text: Which he wrought in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, and set him at his own right hand in the heavenly places, Far above all principality, and power, and might, and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this world, but also in that which is to come.

cards.revelation_key: Jesus isn't in heaven as a guest. He's on the throne as KING. And you are seated with Him in heavenly places (Ephesians 2:6).

discovery_questions.question: Jesus said 'it is expedient... that I go away' to send the Holy Spirit. Do you live with awareness that the Holy Spirit is IN you, not just with you?
Before ascending, Jesus said 'ye shall be witnesses.' Are you being a witness for Christ in your Jerusalem (home), Judea (city), Samaria (enemies), and uttermost parts of the earth?
The angels said 'this same Jesus... shall so come.' Do you live with active hope of Christ's return, or have you settled into this world?

prayer.title: Prayer of Expectation
prayer.content: Ascended Jesus, crowned King, exalted Lord. Thank You that Your ascension wasn't abandonment, but victory. You ascended to the throne to reign over all. Thank You that from Your throne You intercede for me constantly. Thank You that You sent the Holy Spirit to dwell in me. Holy Spirit, fill me with Your power today. Give me boldness to witness for Christ where I am. Give me love for the lost. Give me vision to reach those who don't know Jesus. And Lord Jesus, come quickly. Just as You left in a cloud of glory, come again in power and glory. Maranatha - come, Lord Jesus. In the name of the exalted King, Amen.
